item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Gets First Patch
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/dragon-age-the-veilguard-gets-first-patch/

EA and BioWare have released the first patch for Dragon Age: The Veilguard. The update comes a week after Dragon Age: The Veilguard released to a mostly strong response.

“Whether you’ve already been playing or are jumping in for the first time, we have our first patch releasing today with a few quality of life improvements and bug fixes,” BioWare wrote on the game’s website. “We’ll also be supporting the game with additional patches in the future to help make your playing experience even better.” 

RELATED: Dragon Age Remaster Unlikely, Creative Director Says

You can check out the full patch notes below via EA.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard Patch Notes

N7 Day Content: 

  • Rook can find a new N7 day appearance in the Lighthouse. This is a cosmetic only armor.

Bug Fixes:

  • Fixed an issue where DLSS options could end up “grayed-out” on a 40-series Nvidia GPU. (PC Only)
  • Eliminated the cause of a small number of crashes. (PC Only)
  • Updated XeSS version to 1.3.1. (PC Only)
  • Fixed an issue where some customizations were not applied to the Inquisitor correctly in one of the ending scenes.
  • Fixed a bug that caused Companion Skill Points to reset.
  • Adjusted Companion Approval notifications so they remain on-screen longer as scenes end.
  • Harding now has arrows in her quiver and is ready for battle.
  • Global banter should no longer start too early.
  • Harding and Taash banter no longer repeats indefinately.
  • Fixed potential issues that could occur if a player fast traveled during a quest.
  • Changing your party members on the way to certain quests no longer breaks the camera for in-world missions.
  • Updated a number of assets to improve visual performance over long distances.
  • Fixed several distance “pop-ins” on level art assets.
  • Added collision to several assets that were missing it.
  • Fixed a minor texture issue with codex art.
  • Added haptics to a number of interactions and events.
  • Fixed lip sync in some ambient scenes.
  • Adjusted audio balance on several assets.
  • Changing equipment no longer disables helmet voice processing.
  • Fixed several objective markers that were spawning improperly.
  • Cleaned up certain interactions between Skills that caused them to not behave as described.
  • Apparitions generated by Iron Veil will now attack Razikale.
  • Entropic Spheres now behave properly on vertical surfaces.
  • Fixed a bug where Taunt would sometimes be cleared early, which caused enemies to ignore it.
  • Fixed a rare issue where Rogues would not hold their bow while aiming down sights.
  • Made the detailed-stats screen more readable.
  • Balance changes made to certain fights to match design intent.
  • Balance adjustments made to several player skills.
  • Fixed leashing exploits on major encounters.
  • The Rage Demon’s Ring of Fire should now be appropriately dodgeable in all situations.
  • Slowed down the speedy raven in Hossberg.
  • Adjusted creepy corpse movement while they moved on/off-camera.
  • The Dalish elf in the Unwanted Guests quest is now an actual elf.
  • Fixed a rare blocking issue in the Sea of Blood quest.
  • Halla should no longer float during the In Entropy’s Grasp quest.
  • Fixed a blocking issue in the Pinnacle of Its Kind quest.
  • Adjusted timing on epilogue text cards.
  • NPC necks no longer grow unexpectedly.
  • Corrected instances where NPCs would not properly look at each other or at Rook.
  • Long hair should now properly mesh with certain armor.
  • Fixed several issues with makeup in character creation.
  • Venatori crystal VFX should now disappear properly.
  • Added scroll wheel support to the sell screen.
  • Opening the journal while on the map no longer causes it to continue scrolling.
  • The Faction Achievements will now be gained properly upon reaching max Faction Strength instead of the Faction Cap.

item.title: God of War: Ragnarok Receives a PS5 Pro Enhanced Mode
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/god-of-war-ragnarok-receives-a-ps5-pro-enhanced-mode/

God of War: Ragnarok now has the PS5 Pro Enhanced label, with ver 6.00 going live today. The new patch also introduces some new gameplay options and bug fixes. 

God of War: Ragnarok PS5 Pro Features

God of War: Ragnarok has a new PS5 Pro Enhanced Mode, providing Favour Quality mode features while running at 60 FPS. High Frame Rate mode will have an unlocked frame rate on monitors with variable refresh rates. The Favour Performance mode from the base PS5 receives a boost on the Pro. Lastly, a PSSR upscale option is available in addition to Temporal Anti-Aliasing. 

Reduced Puzzle Hints in Ragnarok 

God of War: Ragnarok’s update 6.00 will introduce a Reduced Puzzle Hints option, decreasing the number of times the companion provides a hint while solving puzzles. Moreover, a new accessibility option that adds audio descriptions to all game cinematics was added in the same patch.

Bug Fixes

God of War: Ragnarok’s patch 6.00 also arrives with bug fixes. Firstly, an issue where Brock would not path correctly to the shop in Freyr’s camp was fixed. Also, an issue where Hilts could not be crafted if crafted before an NG+ run was fixed. Lastly, Special Resources required for crafting Hilts cannot be sold now, and if sold by accident, the items will drop again. 

In other news, the God of War TV Series is “starting from scratch” as executive producers have left. Also, games like No Man’s Sky, Stellar Blade and Baldur’s Gate 3 received their PS5 Pro updates today. What are your thoughts on God of War Ragnarok’s PS5 Pro Enhanced Mode? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about the Mass Effect TV series officially being developed at Amazon. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Warzone Will Soon Have 177 Weapons, Most of Them Useless
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/warzone-177-weapons/

In a blog post highlighting everything coming to Warzone and Black Ops 6 in season one, it was revealed that the battle royale platform will have 177 weapons for players to choose from. The funny thing is that they’re almost entirely useless as a collective, and players will split their time between just a handful of them.

That collection includes a whopping 33 assault rifles and 30 SMGs.

When is enough enough?

Too Many Weps

Warzone needs something of a reset. Over the years, games have fused with the Warzone ecosystem and had their weapons pulled into the fray, but as time has gone on, it has become increasingly ridiculous. Now, with the delivery of season one, Warzone will have 177 weapons to choose from.

That breakdown looks something like this:

  • Assault Rifles – 33
  • Battle Rifles – 10
  • SMGs – 30
  • Shotguns – 13
  • LMGs – 16
  • Marksman Rifles – 17
  • Sniper Rifles – 16
  • Pistols – 17
  • Launchers – 9
  • Melee – 15

The split includes 60 weapons from Modern Warfare III, 77 from MW II, and 40 from Black Ops 6. At some point, something has to give, because surely keeping up the balancing and maintenance on all 177 weapons is getting a bit tiresome for Activision’s teams.

On November 14, Warzone will also get a new Resurgence map named Area 99, a small-form map inspired by Nuketown. It’s set in the Nevada desert and replicates a top-secret weapons testing facility that was built in the 1950s. It’s almost post-apocalyptic in how it looks, and it should play pretty nicely as well.

Also in the season one update, Urzkistan and Rebirth Island will be returning to the Warzone ecosystem.

Next year, we should have our first return to Verdansk since 2021, which will be a monumental moment for Warzone fans worldwide.

What weapons do you use in Warzone? Let us know in the comments.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that John DiMaggio and Carlos Ferro are returning to Gears of War: E-Day

item.title: John DiMaggio and Carlos Ferro Return in Gears of War: E-Day
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/gears-of-war-e-day-dimaggio-and-ferro/

It has been five months since Gears of War: E-Day was revealed at the Xbox Games Showcase, and not much else has been said about the project. Today, The Coalition revealed that both John DiMaggio (Marcus Fenix) and Carlos Ferro (Dom Santiago) will be returning to reprise their characters in E-Day.

The Glory Days

Gears of War surfaced in 2006, and since it dropped, it has spawned several follow-up titles, widely becoming known as one of the best Xbox-exclusive franchises ever created. It has been five years since the last major release in the series, and it could still be a while yet until the next one drops, given that Gears of War: E-Day doesn’t have a release window.

In June, the next game in the Gears of War series was revealed:

In a post on social media, the team at The Coalition revealed that both John DiMaggio and Carlos Ferro will be reprising their iconic roles in E-Day:

On today’s 18th anniversary of Gears of War, we’re proud to share that John DiMaggio and Carlos Ferro are reprising their roles as the iconic voices of Marcus Fenix and Dominic Santiago in Gears of War: E-Day.

It wouldn’t have been right to have anyone else voice them – especially Marcus Fenix. That gravelly, foreboding tone has been instantly recognisable for almost twenty years.

E-Day will be a prequel of sorts, taking players back to the beginning of the storyline that saw the Locust rise up and lay siege to the world of Sera. The first Gears of War game was the closest we got to that part of the timeline, but now we’re going even further back.

Are you looking forward to Gears of War E-Day? Let us know your expectations in the comments.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news about Black Ops 6’s Ranked Play mode

item.title: Mass Effect TV Series Officially in Development at Amazon
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/mass-effect-tv-series-officially-in-development-at-amazon/

According to a report by Variety, the Mass Effect franchise is receiving a TV adaptation at Amazon MGM Studios. Daniel Casey from F9: The Fast Saga will write and executive produce the series. Karim Zreik, Ari Arad, and Michael Gamble from EA will join as executive producers. At the moment, the plot details haven’t been revealed. 

Mass Effect TV’s Karim Zreik has experience with Marvel TV shows like Daredevil, The Punisher, and more. Ari Arad has worked on other game adaptations, such as Borderlands, Uncharted and more, along with Marvel Movies like Iron Man. 

Mass Effect is a third-person shooter franchise set in a distant future, where humans and aliens have colonised the Milky Way. Microsoft Game Studios previously published the game series, which EA later acquired. 

The main series features four titles: Mass Effect (2007), Mass Effect 2 (2010), Mass Effect 3 (2012) and Mass Effect: Andromeda (2017). The original trilogy follows the journey of Commander Shepard as the character tries to save the galaxy from the hands of the Reapers. Andromeda was unrelated to the trilogy and featured a new setting and fresh characters. 

In other news, Mass Effect 5 is currently being developed by trilogy veterans. Also, Mass Effect fans should have low expectations for N7 Day 2024. What are your thoughts on the Mass Effect TV series? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about every new weapon in Black Ops 6 Season One. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Every New Weapon in Black Ops 6 Season One (and How to Get Them)
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/new-weapons-black-ops-6-coming/

Black Ops 6 is getting a stacked roadmap for season one. It all starts on November 14, and Treyarch has well and truly outdone itself in preparing a sumptuous content drop. There are seven new weapons and new attachments coming to Black Ops 6 from November 14, with some dropping midway through the season just to stagger things a little.

Without further ado, here is every new weapon coming in Black Ops 6 season one.

Guns, Guns, Guns

There are seven major weapons being added to Black Ops 6 in season one, but they won’t all be easy to obtain. Some will only be available to unlock during special events, while others will be battle pass rewards – so you’ll need to grind a little to get to them.

Here’s the full breakdown of new weapons in Black Ops 6 with a note on how to unlock them:

  • Krig C (AR) – Battle Pass unlock
  • SAUG (SMG) – Battle Pass unlock
  • SIRIN 9MM (SMG) – Event unlock
  • Power Drill (Melee) – Event unlock
  • Maelstrom (Shotgun) – Event unlock
  • Cleaver (Melee) – Mid-season unlock
  • AMR MOD 4 (Sniper Rifle) – Mid-season unlock

And here are the two new attachments coming to the game:

  • Buffer Weight Stock
  • Dragon’s Breath

That’s right, Treyarch is adding Dragon’s Breath to Black Ops 6. In case you’ve never heard of that, it’s the incendiary shotgun attachment that turns each shot into a blast of pure heat, lighting your enemies up in a ball of fire.

There are also two new conversion kits coming: XM4 and Kompakt 92 Burst Fire.

Treyarch has promised that there’s more to come as the season unfolds, so this might not be it.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Black Ops 6 Ranked Play is coming on November 14

item.title: Black Ops 6 Ranked Play Starts Next Week
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/black-ops-6-ranked-play/

Competitive fans are celebrating as Treyarch announces the impending arrival of Ranked Play in Black Ops 6. It’s bizarre that it’s surfacing before the Call of Duty League’s 2025 season has been formally announced but never mind.

From November 14, Ranked Play will be live in Black Ops 6, giving the more talented players a place to flex their abilities. Let’s just hope it doesn’t end up like Modern Warfare III and have the Top 250 ranks overflowing with cheaters, right?

Where Will You Rank?

Treyarch revealed the roadmap for season one of Black Ops 6 and Warzone, all of which kicks off on November 14.

There’s a stacked content drop coming, including new maps, a fresh Resurgence experience, new modes (including Prop Hunt), and a massive host of new weapons. It’s an exciting time to be a Call of Duty fan, and hopefully, you’ve finished your Dark Matter grind in time to pick up everything that season one has to offer.

It’ll be as typical a competitive system as you could hope for.

It’s good to see that Activision has learned from past mistakes. In previous games, Ranked Play didn’t arrive for several months. Last year’s Call of Duty – Modern Warfare III – was released in October, but Ranked Play didn’t arrive until February. That was an insane gap that left ambitious fans hungry for a bigger challenge, and it harmed the game’s ecosystem to no end.

Will you be diving into Ranked Play when it arrives? Let us know in the comments.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Prop Hunt is coming back to COD

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Prop Hunt is Coming Back to Call of Duty on November 14
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/prop-hunt-black-ops-6/

Prop Hunt is a fan favourite mode that offers a change of pace from storming around online and sweating to grind camos. However, it hasn’t been seen in a Call of Duty game since 2020’s Black Ops Cold War.

That’s set to change, though. Treyarch has just revealed that on November 14, when Black Ops 6’s first season goes live, it’ll bring with it a new iteration of Prop Hunt.

Proper Fun

Prop Hunt has been in a few Call of Duty games, but it’s by no means a common game mode. In recent years, it appeared in Black Ops 4, Cold War, Modern Warfare, and COD Mobile, but it has been almost four years since it was in a Call of Duty title.

On November 14, Treyarch and Raven Software will deploy the first season of Black Ops 6 and Warzone, and along with that comes Prop Hunt.

In case you’re not familiar, Prop Hunt sees one team assume the role of prop hunters, while the other team becomes a series of ‘props’. That means that they become barrels, crates, lamps, vending machines – anything around a given map that makes sense. They’ll then need to ‘hide’ as a prop while the hunters try to weed them out.

It’s great fun and it’s nothing competitive at all. It’s one of the most casual modes in the Call of Duty ecosystem, and that’s why gamers appreciate it. It makes a nice break from the cacophony of traditional multiplayer modes.

In season one, alongside Prop Hunt, Black Ops 6 players will also get access to ‘Ransack’ and Ranked Play, which is sure to ignite a vibrant competitive ecosystem that’ll last until the next Call of Duty game comes around.

Are you going to play Prop Hunt? Let us know in the comments.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that The Replacer is coming as a Tracer Pack in Black Ops 6

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Darktide Drops for PS5 This December
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/warhammer-40000-darktide-drops-for-ps5-this-december/

The Warhammer Official account on X (formerly Twitter) has announced that Warhammer 40,000: Darktide will be released for PS5 on December 3, 2024. 

Till 2023, Warhammer 40,000: Darktide was only available on PC and Xbox Series X/S, and now it’s finally arriving for PS5. The Standard Edition costs $39.99 and provides access to the base game. There’s also an Imperial Edition up for grabs at $59.99. 

Warhammer 40,000: Darktide’s Imperial Edition will provide players 6 days of early access on the PS5. Along with that, players will also receive the Loyalist Pack, which includes four unique class outfits, eight weapon skin patterns, one set of headgear and an Ogryn body tattoo; the Mortis Veteran Portrait Frame; Caducades Backpack and 2500 Aquilas (premium currency). 

The developers have confirmed that PlayStation Plus will be required to play the game. 

About Warhammer 40,000: Darktide

Warhammer 40,000: Darktide is a co-op-focused action shooter developed by the created of the Vermintide series. In this game, players and their friends will battle against hordes of difficult foes as they retrieve control over Tetrium City. Amidst the chaos, a more mysterious and sinister foe lies dormant, and it’s up to you and your crew to get rid of the enemy before the city gets taken over. 

In other news, here’s what you need to know about Warhammer: 40,000: Space Marine 2’s Campaign Difficulty modes. Also, check out the game’s post-launch roadmap. What are your thoughts on Warhammer 40,000: Darktide releasing for PS5? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about the Replacer arriving as a playable operator in Black Ops 6. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: The Replacer Will Be In a Black Ops 6 Tracer Pack From November 14
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/the-replacer-operator-black-ops-6/

We thought it would happen, and Treyarch is delivering. From November 14, The Replacer will surface in Black Ops 6 as a playable operator, being added to the game in a tracer pack named for the character himself. In the weeks leading up to the launch of Black Ops 6, The Replacer was everywhere, and it was the most successful part of Activision’s marketing campaign for the game.

Replace Your Operators

On November 14, Black Ops 6’s season one update will go live, introducing new maps, modes, weapons, events, and much more. One of the most exciting things about the season one patch is the arrival of The Replacer in playable form.

Given his involvement in the marketing campaign before Black OPs 6 hit the market and his long-time connection to the Black Ops series, he’ll likely be a fan-favourite tracer pack purchase as soon as the first season drops.

It’s important to stress that he’s being added within a tracer pack bundle, so he won’t be a unique operator. Instead, he’ll replace an existing one as a playable skin. So, he’s technically an operator, but kind of isn’t. Similarly, midway through the season, a bizarre, neon-fuelled character named Brightmare will be added, also to replace an existing operator.

The only new operators this season will be Sev (Tier 100) and Goliath (Blackcell).

Black Ops 6’s season one update introduces a huge amount of content, from the new Area 99 resurgence map in Warzone to Prop Hunt in multiplayer. It’s a stacked roadmap for sure.

Are you looking forward to the first season of Black Ops 6?

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Black Ops 6 is getting a Stakeout 24/7 playlist
